absscint_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: This is a fundamental aspect of the changes in the hydrological cycle and their impact on the oceans, and due to new numerical schemes and vertical discretizations, it is important to calculate it consistently with the model formulation.
absscint_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Integral wrt depth of seawater absolute salinity expressed as salt mass content

agessc_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
agessc_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Time elapsed since water was last in surface layer of the ocean.
agessc_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Sea Water Age Since Surface Contact

areacello_ti-u-hxy-u.comment: Cell areas for any grid used to report ocean variables and variables which are requested as used on the model ocean grid (e.g. hfsso, which is a downward heat flux from the atmosphere interpolated onto the ocean grid). These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of global integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere).

basin_ti-u-hxy-u.comment: A variable with the standard name of region contains strings which indicate geographical regions. These strings must be chosen from the standard region list.

bigthetao_tavg-l-hm-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
bigthetao_tavg-l-hm-sea.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.
bigthetao_tavg-l-hm-sea.long_name: Global Average Sea Water Conservative Temperature

bigthetao_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
bigthetao_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

bigthetao_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.
bigthetao_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Sea Water Conservative Temperature at 200 meters

chcint_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: This is the vertically-integrated heat content derived from conservative temperature (bigthetao).
chcint_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Depth Integrated Seawater Conservative Temperature Expressed As Heat Content

deptho_ti-u-hxy-sea.comment: Ocean bathymetry. Reported here is the sea floor depth for present day relative to z=0 geoid. Reported as missing for land grid cells.

difmxybo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
difmxybo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Lateral biharmonic viscosity applied to the momentum equations.

difmxylo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
difmxylo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Lateral Laplacian viscosity applied to the momentum equations.

diftrblo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
diftrblo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Ocean tracer diffusivity associated with parameterized eddy-induced advective transport. Sometimes this diffusivity is called the "thickness" diffusivity. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was called "ocean tracer bolus laplacian diffusivity".  The CMIP6 name is physically more relevant.
diftrblo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Ocean Tracer Diffusivity Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection

diftrelo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
diftrelo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Ocean tracer diffusivity associated with parameterized eddy-induced diffusive transport oriented along neutral or isopycnal directions. Sometimes this diffusivity is called the neutral diffusivity or isopycnal diffusivity or Redi diffusivity.

difvho_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
difvho_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to prognostic temperature field.

difvso_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
difvso_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to prognostic salinity field.

dispkexyfo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
dispkexyfo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Depth integrated impacts on kinetic energy arising from lateral frictional dissipation associated with Laplacian and/or biharmonic viscosity. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was 3d, whereas the CMIP6 depth integrated diagnostic is sufficient for many purposes and reduces archive requirements.
dispkexyfo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Ocean Kinetic Energy Dissipation per Unit Area Due to XY Friction

dxto_ti-u-hxy-u.comment: The linear extent of the cell in the x direction of the horizontal grid centered at t-points (points for tracers such as temperature, salinity, etc.). Not applicable to unstructured grids.
dxto_ti-u-hxy-u.long_name: Cell Length in the X Direction at t-points

dxuo_ti-u-hxy-u.comment: The linear extent of the cell in the x direction of the horizontal grid centered at u-points (points for velocity in the x-direction). Not applicable to unstructured grids.
dxuo_ti-u-hxy-u.long_name: Cell Length in the X Direction at u-points

dxvo_ti-u-hxy-u.comment: The linear extent of the cell in the x direction of the horizontal grid centered at v-points (points for velocity in the y-direction). Not applicable to unstructured grids.
dxvo_ti-u-hxy-u.long_name: Cell Length in the X Direction at v-points

dyto_ti-u-hxy-u.comment: The linear extent of the cell in the y direction of the horizontal grid centered at t-points (points for tracers such as temperature, salinity, etc.). Not applicable to unstructured grids.
dyto_ti-u-hxy-u.long_name: Cell Length in the Y Direction at t-points

dyuo_ti-u-hxy-u.comment: The linear extent of the cell in the y direction of the horizontal grid centered at u-points (points for velocity in the x-direction). Not applicable to unstructured grids.
dyuo_ti-u-hxy-u.long_name: Cell Length in the Y Direction at u-points

dyvo_ti-u-hxy-u.comment: The linear extent of the cell in the y direction of the horizontal grid centered at v-points (points for velocity in the y-direction). Not applicable to unstructured grids.
dyvo_ti-u-hxy-u.long_name: Cell Length in the Y Direction at v-points

evs_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.cell_methods: area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea time: mean
evs_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.comment: computed as the total mass of water vapor evaporating from the ice-free portion of the ocean  divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
evs_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.long_name: Water Evaporation Flux Where Ice Free Ocean over Sea

ficeberg_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ficeberg_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: computed as the iceberg melt water  flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
ficeberg_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Icebergs

ficeberg_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ficeberg_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: computed as the iceberg melt water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
ficeberg_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Icebergs

flandice_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
flandice_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean due to land ice (runoff water from surface and base of land ice or melt from base of ice shelf or vertical ice front) into the ocean divided by the area ocean portion of the grid cell
flandice_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Land Ice

friver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
friver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
friver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Rivers

fsitherm_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
fsitherm_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: computed as the sea ice thermodynamic water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
fsitherm_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water Due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics

hfacrossline_tavg-u-ht-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
hfacrossline_tavg-u-ht-sea.comment: Depth-integrated total heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes across different lines on the Earth's surface (based on appendix J and table J1 of Griffies et al., 2016). Formally, this means the integral along the line of the normal component of the heat transport. Positive and negative numbers refer to total northward/eastward and southward/westward transports, respectively. The transport should be evaluated for the full depth of the ocean, except for the Pacific Equatorial Undercurrent, which is averaged from the surface to 350m. Use Celsius for temperature scale.

hfbasin_tavg-u-hys-sea.cell_methods: longitude: sum (basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
hfbasin_tavg-u-hys-sea.comment: Contains contributions from all physical processes affecting the northward heat transport, including resolved advection, parameterized advection, lateral diffusion, etc. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.   Use Celsius for temperature scale.

hfbasinpadv_tavg-u-hys-sea.cell_methods: longitude: sum (basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
hfbasinpadv_tavg-u-hys-sea.comment: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized eddy-induced advective transport due to any subgrid advective process. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.
hfbasinpadv_tavg-u-hys-sea.long_name: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection

hfbasinpmadv_tavg-u-hys-sea.cell_methods: longitude: sum (basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
hfbasinpmadv_tavg-u-hys-sea.comment: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced advective transport. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.
hfbasinpmadv_tavg-u-hys-sea.long_name: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection

hfbasinpmdiff_tavg-u-hys-sea.cell_methods: longitude: sum (basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
hfbasinpmdiff_tavg-u-hys-sea.comment: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced diffusive transport (i.e., neutral diffusion). Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.
hfbasinpmdiff_tavg-u-hys-sea.long_name: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion

hfbasinpsmadv_tavg-u-hys-sea.cell_methods: longitude: sum (basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
hfbasinpsmadv_tavg-u-hys-sea.comment: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced advective transport. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.
hfbasinpsmadv_tavg-u-hys-sea.long_name: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection

hfds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any "flux adjustment") .
hfds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface

hfevapds_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.cell_methods: area: time: mean where ice_free_sea over sea
hfevapds_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.comment: This is defined as "where ice_free_sea over sea"
hfevapds_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.long_name: Temperature Flux Due to Evaporation Expressed as Heat Flux out of Sea Water

hfgeou_ti-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfgeou_ti-u-hxy-sea.comment: Upward geothermal heat flux per unit area on the sea floor
hfgeou_ti-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Upward Geothermal Heat Flux at Sea Floor

hfibthermds_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfibthermds_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Iceberg Thermodynamics

hfibthermds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfibthermds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Iceberg Thermodynamics

hfrainds_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.cell_methods: area: time: mean where ice_free_sea over sea
hfrainds_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.comment: This is defined as "where ice_free_sea over sea"; i.e., the total flux (considered here) entering the ice-free portion of the grid cell divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  All such heat fluxes are computed based on Celsius scale.
hfrainds_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.long_name: Temperature Flux Due to Rainfall Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water

hfrunoffds_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfrunoffds_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Heat flux associated with liquid water which drains from land. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius.
hfrunoffds_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Temperature Flux Due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water

hfrunoffds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfrunoffds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Heat flux associated with liquid water which drains from land. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius.
hfrunoffds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Temperature Flux Due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water

hfsnthermds_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfsnthermds_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "Snow thermodynamics" refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.
hfsnthermds_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Snow Thermodynamics

hfsnthermds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfsnthermds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "Snow thermodynamics" refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.
hfsnthermds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Snow Thermodynamics

hfx_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfx_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale

hfx_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
hfx_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Ocean heat x transport vertically integrated over the whole ocean depth. Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale. Report on native horizontal grid.
hfx_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Vertically Integrated Ocean Heat X Transport

hfy_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfy_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale.

hfy_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
hfy_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Ocean heat y transport vertically integrated over the whole ocean depth. Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale. Report on native horizontal grid.
hfy_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Vertically Integrated Ocean Heat Y Transport

htovgyre_tavg-u-hys-sea.cell_methods: longitude: sum (basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
htovgyre_tavg-u-hys-sea.comment: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
htovgyre_tavg-u-hys-sea.long_name: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Gyre

htovovrt_tavg-u-hys-sea.cell_methods: longitude: sum (basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
htovovrt_tavg-u-hys-sea.comment: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
htovovrt_tavg-u-hys-sea.long_name: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Overturning

masscello_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
masscello_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times grid celll volume.

masscello_ti-l-hxy-sea.comment: Tracer grid-cell mass per unit area used for computing tracer budgets. For Boussinesq models with static ocean grid cell thickness, masscello = rhozero\*thickcello, where thickcello is static cell thickness and rhozero is constant Boussinesq reference density. More generally, masscello is time dependent and reported as part of Omon.

masso_tavg-u-hm-sea.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
masso_tavg-u-hm-sea.comment: Total mass of liquid sea water. For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times total volume.

mfo_tavg-u-ht-sea.cell_methods: depth: sum where sea time: mean
mfo_tavg-u-ht-sea.comment: Transport across_line means that which crosses a particular line on the Earth's surface (based on appendix J and table J1 of Griffies et al, 2016 (<https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-9-3231-2016>). Formally this means the integral along the line of the normal component of the transport. The transport should be evaluated for the full depth of the ocean, except for the Pacific Equatorial Undercurrent, which is averaged from the surface to 350m.

mlotst_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
mlotst_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface. Defined by Sigma T of 0.03 kg m-3 wrt to model level closest to 10 m depth.
mlotst_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T

mlotstmax_tstat-u-hxy-sea.comment: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface. Defined by Sigma T of 0.03 kg m-3 wrt to model level closest to 10 m depth.
mlotstmax_tstat-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Maximum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T

mlotstmin_tstat-u-hxy-sea.comment: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface. Defined by Sigma T of 0.03 kg m-3 wrt to model level closest to 10 m depth.
mlotstmin_tstat-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Minimum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T

mlotstsq_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
mlotstsq_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: The phrase "square_of_X" means X\*X. The ocean mixed layer is the upper part of the ocean, regarded as being well-mixed. The base of the mixed layer defined by "temperature", "sigma", "sigma_theta", "sigma_t" or vertical diffusivity is the level at which the quantity indicated differs from its surface value by a certain amount. A coordinate variable or scalar coordinate variable with standard name sea_water_sigma_t_difference can be used to specify the sigma_t criterion that determines the layer thickness. Sigma-t of sea water is the density of water at atmospheric pressure (i.e. the surface) having the same temperature and salinity, minus 1000 kg m-3. "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer.
mlotstsq_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Square of Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T

mpw_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
mpw_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.

mpwswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
mpwswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) of swell waves only (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.

mpwwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
mpwwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) of wind-sea waves only (i.e., local wind waves). In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.

msftbarot_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
msftbarot_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Streamfunction or its approximation for free surface models. See OMDP document for details.

msftmz_tavg-l-hys-sea.cell_methods: longitude: sum (basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
msftmz_tavg-l-hys-sea.comment: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

msftmz_tavg-rho-hys-sea.cell_methods: longitude: sum (basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
msftmz_tavg-rho-hys-sea.comment: CMIP5 called this "due to Bolus Advection".  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.
msftmz_tavg-rho-hys-sea.long_name: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection

msftmzmpa_tavg-l-hys-sea.cell_methods: longitude: sum (basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
msftmzmpa_tavg-l-hys-sea.comment: CMIP5 called this "due to Bolus Advection".  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.
msftmzmpa_tavg-l-hys-sea.long_name: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection

msftmzsmpa_tavg-l-hys-sea.cell_methods: longitude: sum (basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
msftmzsmpa_tavg-l-hys-sea.comment: Report only if there is a submesoscale eddy parameterization.
msftmzsmpa_tavg-l-hys-sea.long_name: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection

msftyz_tavg-l-ht-sea.comment: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

msftyz_tavg-rho-hm-sea.comment: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

msftyzmpa_tavg-l-ht-sea.comment: CMIP5 called this "due to Bolus Advection".  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.
msftyzmpa_tavg-l-ht-sea.long_name: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection

msftyzmpa_tavg-rho-ht-sea.comment: CMIP5 called this "due to Bolus Advection".  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.
msftyzmpa_tavg-rho-ht-sea.long_name: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection

obvfsq_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
obvfsq_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: The phrase "square_of_X" means X\*X. Frequency is the number of oscillations of a wave per unit time. Brunt-Vaisala frequency is also sometimes called "buoyancy frequency" and is a measure of the vertical stratification of the medium.
obvfsq_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Square of Brunt Vaisala Frequency in Sea Water

ocontempdiff_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocontempdiff_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized dianeutral mixing. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
ocontempdiff_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Dianeutral Mixing

ocontempmint_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocontempmint_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Full column sum of density\*cell thickness\*conservative temperature. If the model is Boussinesq, then use Boussinesq reference density for the density factor.
ocontempmint_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Depth Integral of Product of Sea Water Density and Conservative Temperature

ocontemppadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocontemppadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized eddy advection (all forms of eddy advection). Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
ocontemppadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection

ocontemppmdiff_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocontemppmdiff_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized mesoscale eddy diffusion. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
ocontemppmdiff_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion

ocontemppsmadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocontemppsmadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized submesoscale eddy advection. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
ocontemppsmadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection

ocontemprmadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocontemprmadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from residual mean  (sum of Eulerian mean + parameterized eddy-induced) advection. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
ocontemprmadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Residual Mean Advection

ocontemptend_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocontemptend_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from all processes. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
ocontemptend_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content

opottempdiff_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
opottempdiff_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized dianeutral mixing. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.
opottempdiff_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Dianeutral Mixing

opottempmint_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
opottempmint_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Full column sum of density\*cell thickness\*potential temperature. If the model is Boussinesq, then use Boussinesq reference density for the density factor.
opottempmint_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Integral with Respect to Depth of Product of Sea Water Density and Potential Temperature

opottemppadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
opottemppadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized  eddy advection (all forms of eddy advection). Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.
opottemppadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection

opottemppmdiff_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
opottemppmdiff_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized mesoscale eddy diffusion. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.
opottemppmdiff_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion

opottemppsmadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
opottemppsmadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized submesoscale eddy advection. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.
opottemppsmadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection

opottemprmadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
opottemprmadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from residual mean (sum of Eulerian mean + parameterized eddy-induced) advection. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.
opottemprmadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Residual Mean Advection

opottemptend_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
opottemptend_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from all processes. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.
opottemptend_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content

osaltdiff_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
osaltdiff_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from parameterized dianeutral mixing.
osaltdiff_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Dianeutral Mixing

osaltpadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
osaltpadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from parameterized eddy advection (any form of eddy advection).
osaltpadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection

osaltpmdiff_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
osaltpmdiff_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from parameterized mesoscale eddy diffusion.
osaltpmdiff_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion

osaltpsmadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
osaltpsmadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from parameterized submesoscale eddy advection.
osaltpsmadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection

osaltrmadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
osaltrmadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from residual mean  (sum of Eulerian mean + parameterized eddy-induced)  advection.
osaltrmadvect_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Residual Mean Advection

osalttend_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
osalttend_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from all processes.
osalttend_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content

pbo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
pbo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: "Sea water pressure" is the pressure that exists in the medium of sea water.  It includes the pressure due to overlying sea water, sea ice, air and any other medium that may be present.
pbo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Sea Water Pressure at Sea Floor

pfscint_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: This is a fundamental aspect of the changes in the hydrological cycle and their impact on the oceans, and due to new numerical schemes and vertical discretizations, it is important to calculate it consistently with the model formulation.
pfscint_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Integral wrt depth of seawater preformed salinity expressed as salt mass content

phcint_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: This is the vertically-integrated heat content derived from potential temperature (thetao).
phcint_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Integrated Ocean Heat Content from Potential Temperature

pso_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
pso_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.  "Sea water pressure" is the pressure that exists in the medium of sea water.  It includes the pressure due to overlying sea water, sea ice, air and any other medium that may be present.
pso_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Sea Water Pressure at Sea Water Surface

rsdo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
rsdo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Downwelling Shortwave Radiation in Sea Water
rsdo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Downwelling Shortwave Radiation in Sea Water

rsdoabsorb_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
rsdoabsorb_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from penetrative shortwave radiation within a grid cell.
rsdoabsorb_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Net Rate of Absorption of Shortwave Energy in Ocean Layer

rsds_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.cell_methods: area: time: mean where ice_free_sea over sea
rsds_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.comment: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of an ocean grid cell not covered by sea ice. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
rsds_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.long_name: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over Ocean Not Covered by Sea Ice

rsds_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of an ocean grid cell covered by sea ice, including snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
rsds_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over Sea Ice

rsntds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
rsntds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: The radiative flux into the surface of liquid sea water only. This excludes shortwave flux absorbed by sea ice, but includes any light that passes through the ice and is absorbed by the ocean.
rsntds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Net Downward Shortwave Radiation at Sea Water Surface

rsus_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.comment: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of an ocean grid cell not covered by sea ice. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
rsus_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.long_name: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over Ocean Not Covered by Sea Ice

rsus_tavg-u-hxy-si.comment: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of an ocean grid cell covered by sea ice, including snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
rsus_tavg-u-hxy-si.long_name: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over Sea Ice

scint_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: This is a fundamental aspect of the changes in the hydrological cycle and their impact on the oceans, and due to new numerical schemes and vertical discretizations, it is important to calculate it consistently with the model formulation.
scint_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Integral wrt depth of seawater practical salinity expressed as salt mass content

sduo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sduo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: The eastward component of the net drift velocity of ocean water caused by surface wind-sea waves. The Stokes drift velocity could be defined as the difference between the average Lagrangian flow velocity of a fluid parcel, and the average Eulerian flow velocity of the fluid at a fixed position.

sdvo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sdvo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: The northward component of the net drift velocity of ocean water caused by surface wind-sea waves. The Stokes drift velocity could be defined as the difference between the average Lagrangian flow velocity of a fluid parcel, and the average Eulerian flow velocity of the fluid at a fixed position.

sf6_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sf6_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox_expressed_as_nitrogen". The chemical formula of sulfur hexafluoride is SF6.
sf6_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Mole Concentration of SF6 in Sea Water

sfdsi_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sfdsi_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.
sfdsi_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux

sfo or sfmo_tavg-u-ht-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
sfo or sfmo_tavg-u-ht-sea.comment: Depth-integrated total salt mass transport from resolved and parameterized processes across different lines on the Earth's surface (based on appendix J and table J1 of Griffies et al., 2016). Formally, this means the integral along the line of the normal component of the heat transport. Positive and negative numbers refer to total northward/eastward and southward/westward transports, respectively. The transport should be evaluated for the full depth of the ocean, except for the Pacific Equatorial Undercurrent, which is averaged from the surface to 350m.
sfo or sfmo_tavg-u-ht-sea.long_name: Ocean Salt Mass Transport across Lines

sfriver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sfriver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: This field is physical, and it arises when rivers carry a nonzero salt content.  Often this is zero, with rivers assumed to be fresh.
sfriver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers

sftof_ti-u-hxy-u.comment: This is the area fraction at the ocean surface.

sfx_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sfx_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' salt mass transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Report on native horizontal grid.

sfx_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
sfx_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Ocean salt mass x transport vertically integrated over the whole ocean depth. Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' salt mass transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Report on native horizontal grid.
sfx_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Vertically Integrated Ocean Salt Mass X Transport

sfy_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sfy_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' salt mass transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Report on native horizontal grid.

sfy_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
sfy_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Ocean salt mass y transport vertically integrated over the whole ocean depth. Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' salt mass transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Report on native horizontal grid.
sfy_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Vertically Integrated Ocean Salt Mass Y Transport

sltbasin_tavg-u-hys-sea.cell_methods: longitude: sum (basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
sltbasin_tavg-u-hys-sea.comment: Northward Ocean Salt Transport from all physical processes affecting northward salt transport, resolved and parameterized. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.

sltovgyre_tavg-u-hys-sea.cell_methods: longitude: sum (basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
sltovgyre_tavg-u-hys-sea.comment: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
sltovgyre_tavg-u-hys-sea.long_name: Northward Ocean Salt Transport Due to Gyre

sltovovrt_tavg-u-hys-sea.cell_methods: longitude: sum (basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
sltovovrt_tavg-u-hys-sea.comment: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
sltovovrt_tavg-u-hys-sea.long_name: Northward Ocean Salt Transport Due to Overturning

so_tavg-l-hm-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
so_tavg-l-hm-sea.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

so_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
so_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

sob_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sob_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Model prognostic salinity at bottom-most model grid cell
sob_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Sea Water Salinity at Sea Floor

somint_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
somint_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Full column sum of density\*cell thickness\*salinity. If the model is Boussinesq, then use Boussinesq reference density for the density factor.
somint_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Depth Integral of Product of Sea Water Density and Prognostic Salinity

sos_tavg-u-hm-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sos_tavg-u-hm-sea.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

sos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

sossq_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sossq_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

sw17O_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sw17O_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Ratio of abundance of oxygen-17 (17O) atoms to oxygen-16 (16O) atoms in sea water
sw17O_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Isotopic Ratio of Oxygen-17 in Sea Water

sw18O_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Ratio of abundance of oxygen-18 (18O) atoms to oxygen-16 (16O) atoms in sea water
sw18O_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Isotopic Ratio of Oxygen-18 in Sea Water

sw2H_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sw2H_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Ratio of abundance of hydrogen-2 (2H) atoms to hydrogen-1 (1H) atoms in sea water
sw2H_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Isotopic Ratio of Deuterium in Sea Water

swh_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
swh_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This is a key parameter for describing wave energy and is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.

swhmax_tstat-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: maximum
swhmax_tstat-u-hxy-sea.comment: Highest value of the significant wave height simulated within a given time range (e.g., daily or monthly). The significant wave height (swh) is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, swh is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.

swhswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
swhswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating just swell waves (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). This parameter is derived from all swell partitions of the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the components of the two-dimensional wave spectrum that are not under the influence of local wind.

swhwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
swhwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating just wind-sea waves (i.e., local wind waves). It is derived from the wind-sea wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wind-sea wave spectrum.

t17d_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

t20d_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

tauuo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
tauuo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.
tauuo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Sea Water Surface Downward X Stress

tauvo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
tauvo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.
tauvo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Sea Water Surface Downward Y Stress

thetao_tavg-l-hm-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
thetao_tavg-l-hm-sea.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field
thetao_tavg-l-hm-sea.long_name: Global Average Sea Water Potential Temperature

thetao_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
thetao_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

thetao_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.
thetao_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Sea Water Potential Temperature at 200 meters

thetao_tavg-z2000m-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: depth: time: mean where sea
thetao_tavg-z2000m-hxy-sea.long_name: Depth Average Potential Temperature of Upper 2000m

thetao_tavg-z300m-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: depth: time: mean where sea
thetao_tavg-z300m-hxy-sea.long_name: Depth Average Potential Temperature of Upper 300m

thetao_tavg-z700m-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: depth: time: mean where sea
thetao_tavg-z700m-hxy-sea.long_name: Depth Average Potential Temperature of Upper 700m

thkcello_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
thkcello_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: The time varying thickness of ocean cells. "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer. "Cell" refers to a model grid-cell.

thkcello_ti-l-hxy-sea.comment: Thickness of ocean cells. "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer. "Cell" refers to a model grid-cell.

thkcelluo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
thkcelluo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: The time varying thickness of ocean cells centered at u-points (points for velocity in the x-direction). "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer. "Cell" refers to a model grid-cell.
thkcelluo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Ocean Model Cell Thickness at u-points

thkcellvo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
thkcellvo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: The time varying thickness of ocean cells centered at v-points (points for velocity in the y-direction). "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer. "Cell" refers to a model grid-cell.
thkcellvo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Ocean Model Cell Thickness at v-points

tnkebto_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
tnkebto_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Depth integrated impacts on kinetic energy arising from parameterized eddy-induced advection. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was 3d, whereas the CMIP6 depth integrated diagnostic is sufficient for many purposes and reduces archive requirements.
tnkebto_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Tendency of Ocean Eddy Kinetic Energy Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection

tnpeo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
tnpeo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Rate that work is done against vertical stratification, as measured by the vertical heat and salt diffusivity. Report here as depth integrated two-dimensional field.
tnpeo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Tendency of Ocean Potential Energy Content

tob_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
tob_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Potential temperature at the ocean bottom-most grid cell.
tob_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Sea Water Potential Temperature at Sea Floor

tos_tavg-u-hm-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
tos_tavg-u-hm-sea.comment: This may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice or floating ice shelves. For models using conservative temperature as the prognostic field, they should report the top ocean layer as surface potential temperature, which is the same as surface in situ temperature.

tos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
tos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: This may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice or floating ice shelves. For models using conservative temperature as the prognostic field, they should report the top ocean layer as surface potential temperature, which is the same as surface in situ temperature.

tos_tpt-u-hxy-ifs.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: point
tos_tpt-u-hxy-ifs.comment: temperature of surface of open ocean, sampled synoptically.

tossq_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
tossq_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Square of temperature of liquid ocean, averaged over the day.

umo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
umo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: X-ward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport.

uo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
uo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

uos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
uos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Daily surface prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.
uos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Daily Surface Sea Water X Velocity

vmo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
vmo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Y-ward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport.

vo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
vo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Prognostic y-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

volcello_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
volcello_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: For oceans with more than 1 mesh (e.g. staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy. If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon and Odec fields

volcello_ti-l-hxy-sea.comment: For oceans with more than 1 mesh (e.g. staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy. If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon and Odec fields

volo_tavg-u-hm-sea.cell_methods: depth: area: sum where sea time: mean
volo_tavg-u-hm-sea.comment: Total volume of liquid sea water.

vos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
vos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Daily surface prognostic y-ward velocity component resolved by the model.
vos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Daily Surface Sea Water Y Velocity

vsf_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
vsf_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.
vsf_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water

vsfcorr_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
vsfcorr_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.

vsfevap_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
vsfevap_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: zero for models using real water fluxes.
vsfevap_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Evaporation

vsfpr_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
vsfpr_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: zero for models using real water fluxes.
vsfpr_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Rainfall

vsfriver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
vsfriver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: zero for models using real water fluxes.
vsfriver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers

vsfsit_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
vsfsit_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: This variable measures the virtual salt flux into sea water due to the melting of sea ice. It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.
vsfsit_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics

wdir_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wdir_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

wdir_tavg-z0m-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wdir_tavg-z0m-hxy-sea.comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

wdirswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wdirswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

wdirwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wdirwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves). This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

wfcorr_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wfcorr_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean due to flux correction divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

wfo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wfo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum \*wfonocorr\* and \*wfcorr\*.

wmo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
wmo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Upward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport.

wo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.comment: Prognostic z-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

wpdir_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wpdir_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves, by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

wpdirswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wpdirswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.

wpdirwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wpdirwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.

wpp_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wpp_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Wave period associated with the most energetic waves in total wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves.

wppswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wppswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Wave period associated with the most energetic swell waves (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across part of the two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating just swell waves.

wppwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wppwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: Wave period associated with the most energetic wind-sea waves (i.e., local wind waves). In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across part of the two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating just wind-sea waves.

zfullo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
zfullo_tavg-l-hxy-sea.long_name: Depth Below Geoid of Ocean Layer

zos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
zos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.comment: This is the dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. It should not include inverse barometer depressions from sea ice.

zossq_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
zossq_tavg-u-hxy-sea.long_name: Square of Sea Surface Height Above Geoid

zostoga_tavg-u-hm-sea.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
zostoga_tavg-u-hm-sea.comment: There is no CMIP6 request for zosga nor zossga.
zostoga_tavg-u-hm-sea.long_name: Global Average Thermosteric Sea Level Change
